section.title: Increase Block Storage API service throughput
section.para: By default, the Block Storage API service runs in one process. This limits the number of API requests that the Block Storage service can process at any given time. In a production environment, you should increase the Block Storage API throughput by allowing the Block Storage API service to run in as many processes as the machine capacity allows.

note.para: The Block Storage API service is named openstack-cinder-api on the following distributions: CentOS, Fedora, openSUSE, Red Hat Enterprise Linux, and SUSE Linux Enterprise. In Ubuntu and Debian distributions, the Block Storage API service is named cinder-api.

section.para: To do so, use the Block Storage API service option osapi_volume_workers. This option allows you to specify the number of API service workers (or OS processes) to launch for the Block Storage API service.
To configure this option, open the /etc/cinder/cinder.conf configuration file and set the osapi_volume_workers configuration key to the number of CPU cores/threads on a machine.
